snippet: The International Criminal Court’s charges of crimes against humanity has led to tension with the African Union.
abstract: African-led attempt to postpone trials of Uhuru Kenyatta and William Ruto, Kenya’s top two leaders, at International Criminal Court collapses when it fails to gain enough support on United Nations Security Council; outcome is bitterly criticized by Kenya and other African nations that accuse Council’s majority of patronizing mistrust.
lead_paragraph: The International Criminal Court’s charges of crimes against humanity has led to tension with the African Union.

headline.main: African Call to Delay Kenyans’ Trials Fails at U.N.
headline.print_headline: African Call to Delay Kenyans’ Trials Fails at U.N.
